Author: Boris Pasternak
Quote: Literature is the art of discovering something extraordinary about ordinary people, and saying with ordinary words something extraordinary.

Author: Hunter S. Thompson
Quote: Politics is the art of controlling your environment.

Author: Will Rogers
Quote: Advertising is the art of convincing people to spend money they don't have for something they don't need.

Author: Piet Mondrian
Quote: Just as pure abstract art is not dogmatic, neither is it decorative.

Author: Ludwig van Beethoven
Quote: Don't only practice your art, but force your way into its secrets; art deserves that, for it and knowledge can raise man to the Divine.

Author: Philip Johnson
Quote: Architecture is the art of how to waste space.

Author: Claude Monet
Quote: People discuss my art and pretend to understand as if it were necessary to understand, when it's simply necessary to love.

Author: Frank Lloyd Wright
Quote: Space is the breath of art.

Author: Ray Bradbury
Quote: Science fiction is any idea that occurs in the head and doesn't exist yet, but soon will, and will change everything for everybody, and nothing will ever be the same again. As soon as you have an idea that changes some small part of the world you are writing science fiction. It is always the art of the possible, never the impossible.

Author: Billy Sunday
Quote: There is nothing in the world of art like the songs mother used to sing.

Author: Lady Gaga
Quote: Every bit of me is devoted to love and art. And I aspire to try to be a teacher to my young fans who feel just like I felt when I was younger. I just felt like a freak. I guess what I'm trying to say is I'm trying to liberate them, I want to free them of their fears and make them feel that they can make their own space in the world.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: The most beautiful thing we can experience is the mysterious. It is the source of all true art and science.

Author: Tony Hawk
Quote: I consider skateboarding an art form, a lifestyle and a sport. 'Action sport' would be the least offensive categorization.

Author: Isaac Newton
Quote: Tact is the art of making a point without making an enemy.

Author: Emily Dickinson
Quote: Where thou art, that is home.

Author: Kenneth Lonergan
Quote: Filmmaking, like any other art, is a very profound means of human communication; beyond the professional pleasure of succeeding or the pain of failing, you do want your film to be seen, to communicate itself to other people.

Author: Douglas Horton
Quote: The art of simplicity is a puzzle of complexity.

Author: Edward Dmytryk
Quote: In art, the obvious is a sin.

Author: Paracelsus
Quote: The art of healing comes from nature, not from the physician. Therefore the physician must start from nature, with an open mind.

Author: Sol LeWitt
Quote: Minimal art went nowhere.

Author: Aldous Huxley
Quote: Perhaps it's good for one to suffer. Can an artist do anything if he's happy? Would he ever want to do anything? What is art, after all, but a protest against the horrible inclemency of life?

Author: Harvey Pekar
Quote: I think you can do anything with comics that you could do in just about any art form.

Author: Madeleine L'Engle
Quote: When the bright angel dominates, out comes a great work of art, a Michelangelo David or a Beethoven symphony.

Author: Walter Pater
Quote: All art constantly aspires towards the condition of music.

Author: Madonna Ciccone
Quote: I am my own experiment. I am my own work of art.

Author: LL Cool J
Quote: I am a real person that cares about his art and cares about what he's doing - I have a heart and a soul and want to touch people and give.

Author: Carroll O'Connor
Quote: Even a true artist does not always produce art.

Author: Havelock Ellis
Quote: Every artist writes his own autobiography.

Author: Marc Chagall
Quote: When I am finishing a picture, I hold some God-made object up to it - a rock, a flower, the branch of a tree or my hand - as a final test. If the painting stands up beside a thing man cannot make, the painting is authentic. If there's a clash between the two, it's bad art.

Author: Pierre Bonnard
Quote: Draw your pleasure, paint your pleasure, and express your pleasure strongly.

Author: Charles Dudley Warner
Quote: A great artist can paint a great picture on a small canvas.

Author: James Taylor
Quote: That's the motivation of an artist - to seek attention of some kind.

Author: Edward Steichen
Quote: Every other artist begins with a blank canvas, a piece of paper the photographer begins with the finished product.

Author: Jim Dine
Quote: My attitude towards drawing is not necessarily about drawing. It's about making the best kind of image I can make, it's about talking as clearly as I can.

Author: Leonardo da Vinci
Quote: Where the spirit does not work with the hand, there is no art.

Author: Twyla Tharp
Quote: Art is the only way to run away without leaving home.

Author: Henry Ward Beecher
Quote: Every artist dips his brush in his own soul, and paints his own nature into his pictures.

Author: Horace
Quote: A picture is a poem without words.

Author: Jackson Pollock
Quote: I have no fear of making changes, destroying the image, etc., because the painting has a life of its own.

Author: Henri Cartier-Bresson
Quote: To me, photography is the simultaneous recognition, in a fraction of a second, of the significance of an event.

Author: Alfred Sisley
Quote: Every picture shows a spot with which the artist has fallen in love.

Author: Mary Schmich
Quote: Good art is art that allows you to enter it from a variety of angles and to emerge with a variety of views.

Author: Iris Murdoch
Quote: All art is a struggle to be, in a particular sort of way, virtuous.

Author: Henri Cartier-Bresson
Quote: The creative act lasts but a brief moment, a lightning instant of give-and-take, just long enough for you to level the camera and to trap the fleeting prey in your little box.

Author: Alfred Stieglitz
Quote: The goal of art was the vital expression of self.

Author: Edward Steichen
Quote: Photography is a major force in explaining man to man.

Author: Robert Rauschenberg
Quote: An empty canvas is full.

Author: John Zorn
Quote: I see myself and many artists like me as the torchbearers through these dark ages.

Author: Elbert Hubbard
Quote: The sculptor produces the beautiful statue by chipping away such parts of the marble block as are not needed - it is a process of elimination.

Author: Paul Klee
Quote: One eye sees, the other feels.

Author: Anatole France
Quote: In art as in love, instinct is enough.

Author: Leonardo da Vinci
Quote: A beautiful body perishes, but a work of art dies not.

Author: Charles Eames
Quote: Art resides in the quality of doing, process is not magic.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: True art is characterized by an irresistible urge in the creative artist.

Author: William Morris
Quote: If you cannot learn to love real art, at least learn to hate sham art and reject it.

Author: George Lucas
Quote: All art is dependent on technology because it's a human endeavour, so even when you're using charcoal on a wall or designed the proscenium arch, that's technology.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination.

Author: Joshua Reynolds
Quote: A room hung with pictures is a room hung with thoughts.

Author: Henry Moore
Quote: A sculptor is a person who is interested in the shape of things, a poet in words, a musician by sounds.

Author: Jim Hodges
Quote: When I make art, I think about its ability to connect with others, to bring them into the process.

Author: Ernst Fischer
Quote: I don't want life to imitate art. I want life to be art.

Author: Anish Kapoor
Quote: Artists don't make objects. Artists make mythologies.

Author: Tennessee Williams
Quote: All good art is an indiscretion.

Author: Gian Carlo Menotti
Quote: Art is the unceasing effort to compete with the beauty of flowers - and never succeeding.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: We have art in order not to die of the truth.

Author: Robert Mapplethorpe
Quote: When I work, and in my art, I hold hands with God.

Author: Flannery O'Connor
Quote: The basis of art is truth, both in matter and in mode.

Author: Francis Ford Coppola
Quote: I don't think there's any artist of any value who doesn't doubt what they're doing.

Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
Quote: The mediator of the inexpressible is the work of art.

Author: Jerzy Kosinski
Quote: The principles of true art is not to portray, but to evoke.

Author: Conrad Hall
Quote: Painting and writing are solitary arts.

Author: Robert Delaunay
Quote: Art in Nature is rhythmic and has a horror of constraint.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: Pictures must not be too picturesque.

Author: Albert Camus
Quote: Without freedom, no art; art lives only on the restraints it imposes on itself, and dies of all others.

Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
Quote: Personality is everything in art and poetry.

Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
Quote: It is after all the greatest art to limit and isolate oneself.

Author: Salvador Dali
Quote: The terrifying and edible beauty of Art Nouveau architecture.

Author: Wilson Mizner
Quote: Art is science made clear.

Author: Walter Winchell
Quote: Gossip is the art of saying nothing in a way that leaves practically nothing unsaid.

Author: Ansel Adams
Quote: Photography is more than a medium for factual communication of ideas. It is a creative art.

Author: Pablo Picasso
Quote: Sculpture is the art of the intelligence.

Author: Morihei Ueshiba
Quote: One does not need buildings, money, power, or status to practice the Art of Peace. Heaven is right where you are standing, and that is the place to train.

Author: Denis Waitley
Quote: Winners have the ability to step back from the canvas of their lives like an artist gaining perspective. They make their lives a work of art - an individual masterpiece.

Author: Henry Ward Beecher
Quote: To array a man's will against his sickness is the supreme art of medicine.

Author: Rudyard Kipling
Quote: And the first rude sketch that the world had seen was joy to his mighty heart, till the Devil whispered behind the leaves 'It's pretty, but is it Art?'

Author: Christopher Marlowe
Quote: O, thou art fairer than the evening air clad in the beauty of a thousand stars.

Author: Ayelet Waldman
Quote: A good mother remembers to serve fruit at breakfast, is always cheerful and never yells, manages not to project her own neuroses and inadequacies onto her children, is an active and beloved community volunteer. She remembers to make play dates, her children's clothes fit, she does art projects with them and enjoys all their games.

Author: Guy Kawasaki
Quote: Patience is the art of concealing your impatience.

Author: Benjamin Disraeli
Quote: A great city, whose image dwells in the memory of man, is the type of some great idea. Rome represents conquest; Faith hovers over the towers of Jerusalem; and Athens embodies the pre-eminent quality of the antique world, Art.

Author: Michael Palin
Quote: I am not a great cook, I am not a great artist, but I love art, and I love food, so I am the perfect traveller.

Author: Jean-Michel Basquiat
Quote: I don't think about art when I'm working. I try to think about life.

Author: Frederic Chopin
Quote: Simplicity is the final achievement. After one has played a vast quantity of notes and more notes, it is simplicity that emerges as the crowning reward of art.

Author: Sharon Salzberg
Quote: We can learn the art of fierce compassion - redefining strength, deconstructing isolation and renewing a sense of community, practicing letting go of rigid us-vs.-them thinking - while cultivating power and clarity in response to difficult situations.

Author: Egon Schiele
Quote: Art cannot be modern. Art is primordially eternal.

Author: Erykah Badu
Quote: I'm free. I just do what I want, say what I want, say how I feel, and I don't try to hurt nobody. I just try to make sure that I don't compromise my art in any kind of way, and I think people respect that.

Author: Ludwig Erhard
Quote: A compromise is the art of dividing a cake in such a way that everyone believes he has the biggest piece.

Author: Alicia Keys
Quote: I'm inspired by artists and musicians. There are so many wonderful and talented people in the world. I love discovering new music, new writers, or new art.

Author: Theo Jansen
Quote: The walls between art and engineering exist only in our minds.

Author: Josiah Gilbert Holland
Quote: The temple of art is built in words.

Author: Alfred North Whitehead
Quote: The art of progress is to preserve order amid change and to preserve change amid order.

Author: Wale
Quote: The ability to make somebody feel something: that's art. However you look at it, whether you're an author, a painter, a singer, a rapper, a spoken-word artist - art.

Author: Camille Paglia
Quote: As a longtime fan of talk radio, I'm very worried about the low opinion that conservative hosts and callers have of the American artist. Art is portrayed as a scam, a rip-off and snow job pushed by snobbish elites.

Author: Nicki Minaj
Quote: I've constantly tried new things, even as a child, and have always been obsessed with pink. Now I'm just a little more ladylike and fearless. You should never feel afraid to become a piece of art. It's exhilarating.

Author: Aaron Siskind
Quote: In any art, you don't know in advance what you want to say - it's revealed to you as you say it. That's the difference between art and illustration.

Author: Herbie Hancock
Quote: Music happens to be an art form that transcends language.

Author: Marc Chagall
Quote: In our life there is a single color, as on an artist's palette, which provides the meaning of life and art. It is the color of love.

Author: Samuel Butler
Quote: Life is the art of drawing sufficient conclusions from insufficient premises.

Author: Salvador Dali
Quote: We are all hungry and thirsty for concrete images. Abstract art will have been good for one thing: to restore its exact virginity to figurative art.

Author: Samuel Butler
Quote: Life is not an exact science, it is an art.

Author: Jawaharlal Nehru
Quote: The art of a people is a true mirror to their minds.

Author: Jean Cocteau
Quote: Film will only became an art when its materials are as inexpensive as pencil and paper.

Author: Thomas Berger
Quote: The art and science of asking questions is the source of all knowledge.

Author: Bruno Bettelheim
Quote: Raising children is a creative endeavor, an art rather than a science.

Author: Nicki Minaj
Quote: You should never feel afraid to become a piece of art. It's exhilarating.

Author: Robert Smithson
Quote: A work of art when placed in a gallery loses its charge, and becomes a portable object or surface disengaged from the outside world.

Author: Robert Gottlieb
Quote: What 'War and Peace' is to the novel and 'Hamlet' is to the theater, Swan Lake' is to ballet - that is, the name which to many people stands for and sums up an art form.

Author: Roy Lichtenstein
Quote: Pop Art looks out into the world. It doesn't look like a painting of something, it looks like the thing itself.

Author: Emile Durkheim
Quote: The roles of art, morality, religion, political faith, science itself are not to repair organic exhaustion nor to provide sound functioning of the organs. All this supraphysical life is built and expanded not because of the demands of the cosmic environment but because of the demands of the social environment.

Author: David Rakoff
Quote: Let's face it: professing a deep interest in movies, the absolutely dominant global art form of the last century, is at this point like professing an interest in air. Passion is nice. Erudition is admirable. But it's like that moment when good manners cross over into meaningless etiquette.

Author: Mary Cassatt
Quote: I used to go and flatten my nose against that window and absorb all I could of his art. It changed my life. I saw art then as I wanted to see it.

Author: Irving Penn
Quote: Photographing a cake can be art.

Author: Reggie Watts
Quote: As a child I was very into gadgets and machines and robots. The idea of experimenting with machines to create art was always something I tinkered with.

Author: Arne Jacobsen
Quote: When I travel, I draw and paint sketches which is great fun. And as long as you are fully aware that it has nothing to do with actual art, I think that's all right.

Author: Ali Smith
Quote: It's the word 'artful'; it's such a great word, with its dark and its light side, its art and its cunning, the craft and the crafty of it - I've been preoccupied with the word 'artful' and the twin notions of 'cornucopia' and 'pickpocket' it suggests for quite some time.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: Love of beauty is taste. The creation of beauty is art.

Author: Confucius
Quote: Speak the truth, do not yield to anger; give, if thou art asked for little; by these three steps thou wilt go near the gods.

Author: William Shakespeare
Quote: There's no art to find the mind's construction in the face.

Author: Hunter S. Thompson
Quote: 'Crazy' is a term of art; 'Insane' is a term of law. Remember that, and you will save yourself a lot of trouble.

Author: Jim Morrison
Quote: I think in art, but especially in films, people are trying to confirm their own existences.

Author: Pablo Picasso
Quote: Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.

Author: Theodore Dreiser
Quote: Art is the stored honey of the human soul, gathered on wings of misery and travail.

Author: Andre Gide
Quote: Art begins with resistance - at the point where resistance is overcome. No human masterpiece has ever been created without great labor.

Author: Gustave Courbet
Quote: I hope to live all my life for my art, without abandoning my principles one iota.

Author: Jerzy Kosinski
Quote: The principle of art is to pause, not bypass.

Author: Robert Motherwell
Quote: It may be that the deep necessity of art is the examination of self-deception.

Author: Georges Braque
Quote: Painting is a nail to which I fasten my ideas.

Author: Ashton Kutcher
Quote: Vulnerability is the essence of romance. It's the art of being uncalculated, the willingness to look foolish, the courage to say, 'This is me, and I'm interested in you enough to show you my flaws with the hope that you may embrace me for all that I am but, more important, all that I am not.'

Author: Francoise Sagan
Quote: Art must take reality by surprise.

Author: Edward Hopper
Quote: What I wanted to do was to paint sunlight on the side of a house.

Author: Thomas Merton
Quote: Art enables us to find ourselves and lose ourselves at the same time.

Author: William Wordsworth
Quote: Pictures deface walls more often than they decorate them.

Author: William Morris Hunt
Quote: The mission of art is to represent nature not to imitate her.

Author: Friedrich Schiller
Quote: Art is the daughter of freedom.

Author: Emile Zola
Quote: The artist is nothing without the gift, but the gift is nothing without work.

Author: James Whistler
Quote: An artist is not paid for his labor but for his vision.

Author: John Berger
Quote: What makes photography a strange invention is that its primary raw materials are light and time.

Author: Agnes Martin
Quote: When I think of art I think of beauty. Beauty is the mystery of life. It is not in the eye it is in the mind. In our minds there is awareness of perfection.

Author: Tadao Ando
Quote: My hand is the extension of the thinking process - the creative process.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: Every artist was first an amateur.

Author: Robert Schumann
Quote: To send light into the darkness of men's hearts - such is the duty of the artist.

Author: Carl Rogers
Quote: The very essence of the creative is its novelty, and hence we have no standard by which to judge it.

Author: Paul Strand
Quote: The artist's world is limitless. It can be found anywhere, far from where he lives or a few feet away. It is always on his doorstep.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: No great artist ever sees things as they really are. If he did, he would cease to be an artist.

Author: John F. Kennedy
Quote: If art is to nourish the roots of our culture, society must set the artist free to follow his vision wherever it takes him.

Author: Charles Horton Cooley
Quote: An artist cannot fail; it is a success to be one.

Author: Fran Lebowitz
Quote: Very few people possess true artistic ability. It is therefore both unseemly and unproductive to irritate the situation by making an effort. If you have a burning, restless urge to write or paint, simply eat something sweet and the feeling will pass.

Author: Ellen Key
Quote: When one paints an ideal, one does not need to limit one's imagination.

Author: Jeff Greenfield
Quote: This is part of the involuntary bargain we make with the world just by being alive. We get to experiences the splendor of nature, the beauty of art, the balm of love and the sheer joy of existence, always with the knowledge that illness, injury, natural disaster, or pure evil can end it in an instant for ourselves or someone we love.

Author: Michael Franti
Quote: Music has the power to bring people together like no other art form.

Author: Andrei Tarkovsky
Quote: An artist never works under ideal conditions. If they existed, his work wouldn't exist, for the artist doesn't live in a vacuum. Some sort of pressure must exist. The artist exists because the world is not perfect. Art would be useless if the world were perfect, as man wouldn't look for harmony but would simply live in it.

Author: Kara Walker
Quote: There was a manifesto in the late '60s/early '70s, and it basically laid out what 'black art' was and that it should embrace black history and black culture. There were all these rules - I was shocked, when I found it in a book, that it even existed, that it would demarcate these artists.

Author: William S. Burroughs
Quote: I wasn't exposed to art as I was growing up, and can't recall the first time I saw a work of art. However, I remember very clearly a vision I had of a little green reindeer when I was a child, and visions emanate from the same mythical area where painting resides. Whatever the reason, I immediately felt comfortable working with visual materials.

Author: Andrea Bocelli
Quote: I have trouble with modern art. But in general, all art forms fascinate me - art is the way human beings express what we can't say in words.

Author: Octavio Paz
Quote: The work of art is always unfaithful to its creator... Art lays at a higher level; it says something more, and almost always, it says something different from what the artist wanted to say.

Author: Charlie Parker
Quote: They teach you there's a boundary line to music. But, man, there's no boundary line to art.

Author: Hippocrates
Quote: Life is short, the art long.

Author: George Henry Lewes
Quote: Philosophy and Art both render the invisible visible by imagination.

Author: Lynda Resnick
Quote: Art is a critical component in a well-rounded education. Art is the level playing field - no matter how rich or poor, tall or short, pretty or ugly to the bone, if you can draw, you can find personal fulfillment and build self-confidence. Art is the highest achievement of mankind.

Author: Clive Bell
Quote: Art and Religion are, then, two roads by which men escape from circumstance to ecstasy. Between aesthetic and religious rapture there is a family alliance. Art and Religion are means to similar states of mind.

Author: Alex Grey
Quote: I think that that's why artists make art - it is difficult to put into words unless you are a poet. What it takes is being open to the flow of universal creativity. The Zen artists knew this.

Author: Carrie Mae Weems
Quote: I got my first camera when I was 21 - my boyfriend gave it to me for my birthday - but at that point politics was my life, and I viewed the camera as a tool for expressing my political beliefs rather than as an art medium.

Author: Jack Bowman
Quote: A performance art piece is unprecedented. It is difficult to censor since it has a good possibility of never being done before.

Author: Renzo Piano
Quote: There is something about giving everything to your profession. In Italian, an obsession is not necessarily negative. It's the art of putting all your energy into one thing; it's the art of transforming even what you eat for lunch into architecture.

Author: Banksy
Quote: Graffiti's always been a temporary art form. You make your mark and then they scrub it off.

Author: Franz Werfel
Quote: Religion is the everlasting dialogue between humanity and God. Art is its soliloquy.

Author: Mark Rothko
Quote: Art to me is an anecdote of the spirit, and the only means of making concrete the purpose of its varied quickness and stillness.

Author: Sun Tzu
Quote: In the practical art of war, the best thing of all is to take the enemy's country whole and intact; to shatter and destroy it is not so good.

Author: William Hazlitt
Quote: Cunning is the art of concealing our own defects, and discovering other people's weaknesses.

Author: Bryant H. McGill
Quote: Courtesy is a silver lining around the dark clouds of civilization; it is the best part of refinement and in many ways, an art of heroic beauty in the vast gallery of man's cruelty and baseness.

Author: Claude Debussy
Quote: Art is the most beautiful of all lies.

Author: Gustave Courbet
Quote: I hope to live all my life for my art, without abandoning my principles one iota.

Author: Rainer Maria Rilke
Quote: No great art has ever been made without the artist having known danger.

Author: Russell Simmons
Quote: Art is a way to express yourself and through that you can escape a bad situation.

Author: Janelle Monae
Quote: Some songs you get. Some songs you may not. And I think that's the beauty of art: to question and to ask, to understand the deeper meaning after two or three or four listenings.

Author: Robert Smithson
Quote: Cultural confinement takes place when a curator imposes his own limits on an art exhibition, rather than asking an artist to set his limits.

Author: Dante Alighieri
Quote: Nature is the art of God.

Author: Katharine Hepburn
Quote: I think most of the people involved in any art always secretly wonder whether they are really there because they're good or there because they're lucky.

Author: John Updike
Quote: Professionalism in art has this difficulty: To be professional is to be dependable, to be dependable is to be predictable, and predictability is esthetically boring - an anti-virtue in a field where we hope to be astonished and startled and at some deep level refreshed.

Author: Marilyn Manson
Quote: I think it's the pain and suffering that drive you to become an artist. The art itself should be the pain, sort of exorcising every demon and making you feel like you're a person that matters.

Author: Umberto Eco
Quote: Translation is the art of failure.

Author: Havelock Ellis
Quote: All the art of living lies in a fine mingling of letting go and holding on.

Author: Amiri Baraka
Quote: Thought is more important than art. To revere art and have no understanding of the process that forces it into existence, is finally not even to understand what art is.

Author: William Bernbach
Quote: Advertising is fundamentally persuasion and persuasion happens to be not a science, but an art.

Author: John Updike
Quote: American art in general... takes to surreal exaggerations and metaphors; but its Puritan work ethic has little use for the playful self-indulgence behind Parisian Surrealism.

Author: Zooey Deschanel
Quote: I'm into sincerity in music and sincerity in art. If it doesn't feel true, I don't want to do it. Things that are too dramatic scare me. I think that's why I don't always fit into the world of performing arts.

Author: George Edward Woodberry
Quote: Art has a double visage: it looks before and after. Romance is its forward-looking face. The germ of growth is in romanticism. Formalism, on the other hand, consolidates tradition; gleans what has been gained and makes it facile to the hand or the mind; economizes the energy of genius.

Author: Thomas Sydenham
Quote: The art of medicine was to be properly learned only from its practice and its exercise.

Author: Lester Bangs
Quote: Every great work of art has two faces, one toward its own time and one toward the future, toward eternity.

Author: Norman Rockwell
Quote: Some people have been kind enough to call me a fine artist. I've always called myself an illustrator. I'm not sure what the difference is. All I know is that whatever type of work I do, I try to give it my very best. Art has been my life.

Author: Neil Strauss
Quote: Because it's so easy to medicate our need for self-worth by pandering to win followers, 'likes' and view counts, social media have become the metier of choice for many people who might otherwise channel that energy into books, music or art - or even into their own Web ventures.

Author: Roy Lichtenstein
Quote: I'm not really sure what social message my art carries, if any. And I don't really want it to carry one. I'm not interested in the subject matter to try to teach society anything, or to try to better our world in any way.

Author: Norman Rockwell
Quote: Everyone in those days expected that art students were wild, licentious characters. We didn't know how to be, but we sure were anxious to learn.

Author: Rhys Ifans
Quote: I am an artisan. I only became an artist when people watch what I do. That is when it becomes art.

Author: Nobu Matsuhisa
Quote: Making sushi is an art, and experience is everything.

Author: Anselm Kiefer
Quote: Life is an illusion. I am held together in the nothingness by art.

Author: Barbara Hepworth
Quote: At no point do I wish to be in conflict with any man or masculine thought. It doesn't enter my consciousness. Art is anonymous. It's not competitive with men. It's a complementary contribution.

Author: Maria Sibylla Merian
Quote: Art and nature shall always be wrestling until they eventually conquer one another so that the victory is the same stroke and line: that which is conquered, conquers at the same time.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: Art is individualism, and individualism is a disturbing and disintegrating force.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: Bad people are, from the point of view of art, fascinating studies. They represent colour, variety and strangeness. Good people exasperate one's reason; bad people stir one's imagination.

Author: Jay-Z
Quote: I collect art, and I drink wine... things that I like that I had never been exposed to. But I never said, 'I'm going to buy art to impress this crowd.' That's just ridiculous to me. I don't live my life like that, because how could you be happy with yourself?

Author: Dante Alighieri
Quote: Art, as far as it is able, follows nature, as a pupil imitates his master; thus your art must be, as it were, God's grandchild.

Author: Michel Foucault
Quote: What strikes me is the fact that in our society, art has become something which is only related to objects, and not to individuals, or to life.

Author: Evelyn Waugh
Quote: Art is the symbol of the two noblest human efforts: to construct and to refrain from destruction.

Author: Lewis Mumford
Quote: The chief function of the city is to convert power into form, energy into culture, dead matter into the living symbols of art, biological reproduction into social creativity.

Author: E. M. Forster
Quote: Works of art, in my opinion, are the only objects in the material universe to possess internal order, and that is why, though I don't believe that only art matters, I do believe in Art for Art's sake.

Author: Thomas Wolfe
Quote: Culture is the arts elevated to a set of beliefs.

Author: Michelangelo
Quote: Trifles make perfection, and perfection is no trifle.

Author: Francis Bacon
Quote: Fashion is only the attempt to realize art in living forms and social intercourse.

Author: Roy Lichtenstein
Quote: I like to pretend that my art has nothing to do with me.

Author: Beck
Quote: Art is the child of Nature; yes, her darling child, in whom we trace the features of the mother's face, her aspect and her attitude.

Author: Auguste Rodin
Quote: I choose a block of marble and chop off whatever I don't need.

Author: Salvador Dali
Quote: Drawing is the honesty of the art. There is no possibility of cheating. It is either good or bad.

Author: Pablo Picasso
Quote: Painting is just another way of keeping a diary.

Author: Jackson Pollock
Quote: Painting is self-discovery. Every good artist paints what he is.

Author: Frank Zappa
Quote: Art is making something out of nothing and selling it.

Author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
Quote: Art, like morality, consists in drawing the line somewhere.

Author: Stella Adler
Quote: Life beats down and crushes the soul and art reminds you that you have one.

Author: Agnes Martin
Quote: Art is the concrete representation of our most subtle feelings.

Author: William Morris
Quote: I do not want art for a few any more than education for a few, or freedom for a few.

Author: Jerry Saltz
Quote: Summer is a great time to visit art museums, which offer the refreshing rinse of swimming pools - only instead of cool water, you immerse yourself in art.

Author: Winston Churchill
Quote: Without tradition, art is a flock of sheep without a shepherd. Without innovation, it is a corpse.

Author: David Hockney
Quote: Art has to move you and design does not, unless it's a good design for a bus.

Author: John Updike
Quote: What art offers is space - a certain breathing room for the spirit.

Author: Federico Fellini
Quote: All art is autobiographical. The pearl is the oyster's autobiography.

Author: Paul Gauguin
Quote: Art requires philosophy, just as philosophy requires art. Otherwise, what would become of beauty?

Author: George Bernard Shaw
Quote: Without art, the crudeness of reality would make the world unbearable.

Author: Charles Bukowski
Quote: An intellectual says a simple thing in a hard way. An artist says a hard thing in a simple way.

Author: Ludwig Mies van der Rohe
Quote: I don't want to be interesting. I want to be good.

Author: Wilson Mizner
Quote: It is not in life, but in art that self-fulfillment is to be found.

Author: Marshall McLuhan
Quote: I think of art, at its most significant, as a DEW line, a Distant Early Warning system that can always be relied on to tell the old culture what is beginning to happen to it.

Author: Robert Mondavi
Quote: If you go back to the Greeks and Romans, they talk about all three - wine, food, and art - as a way of enhancing life.

Author: Samuel Butler
Quote: Life is the art of drawing sufficient conclusions from insufficient premises.

Author: Sun Tzu
Quote: The art of war is of vital importance to the state. It is a matter of life and death, a road either to safety or to ruin. Hence it is a subject of inquiry which can on no account be neglected.

Author: Joseph de Maistre
Quote: There is no philosophy without the art of ignoring objections.

Author: Samuel Butler
Quote: Life is not an exact science, it is an art.

Author: Ellsworth Kelly
Quote: Geometry is moribund. I want a lilt and joy to art.

Author: John Desmond Bernal
Quote: The recognition of the art that informs all pure science need not mean the abandonment for it of all present art, rather it will mean the completion of the transformation of art that has already begun.

Author: Marilyn Manson
Quote: I think art is the only thing that's spiritual in the world. And I refuse to forced to believe in other people's interpretations of God. I don't think anybody should be. No one person can own the copyright to what God means.

Author: Deepak Chopra
Quote: For thousands of years, human beings have been obsessed with beauty, truth, love, honor, altruism, courage, social relationships, art, and God. They all go together as subjective experiences, and it's a straw man to set God up as the delusion. If he is, then so is truth itself or beauty itself.

Author: Robert Wilson
Quote: When we look back at the Mayans or ancient Egypt, we look at their art.

Author: Franz Marc
Quote: Serious art has been the work of individual artists whose art has had nothing to do with style because they were not in the least connected with the style or the needs of the masses. Their work arose rather in defiance of their times.

Author: George Herbert Mead
Quote: To so enter into it in nature and art that the enjoyed meanings of life may become a part of living is the attitude of aesthetic appreciation.

Author: Oliver Herford
Quote: Modesty: the gentle art of enhancing your charm by pretending not to be aware of it.

Author: Eddie Vedder
Quote: I think music is the greatest art form that exists, and I think people listen to music for different reasons, and it serves different purposes. Some of it is background music, and some of it is things that might affect a person's day, if not their life, or change an attitude. The best songs are the ones that make you feel something.

Author: Glenn Hughes
Quote: Listen to your inner-voice: Surround yourself with loving, nurturing people. Fall in love with your art and find yourself. Music is the great communicator.

Author: Wendell Pierce
Quote: What thoughts are to the individual, art is to the community as a whole. That's where you reflect on who you are, who you hope to be, what you've gone through, and where you hope to go.

Author: Guy Oseary
Quote: I'm a people person, very approachable. I go out every night, tons of functions. I love all facets of this industry... Music, film, TV, books, art. I love being around creative people.

Author: Emmet Fox
Quote: The art of life is to live in the present moment, and to make that moment as perfect as we can by the realization that we are the instruments and expression of God Himself.

Author: Max Bill
Quote: Even in modern art, artists have used methods based on calculation, inasmuch as these elements, alongside those of a more personal and emotional nature, give balance and harmony to any work of art.

Author: Marshall McLuhan
Quote: Great art speaks a language which every intelligent person can understand. The people who call themselves modernists today speak a different language.

Author: Francis Bacon
Quote: The momentous thing in human life is the art of winning the soul to good or evil.

Author: Daphne Guinness
Quote: Through art, you create your own world.

Author: Norman Lindsay
Quote: Every mind which has given itself to self-expression in art is aware of a directing agency outside its conscious control which it has agreed to label 'inspiration'.

Author: Alice Walton
Quote: There is a lot that horses and art share in common. I have found that most horse people are art lovers, and vice versa.

Author: Isadora Duncan
Quote: Art is not necessary at all. All that is necessary to make this world a better place to live in is to love - to love as Christ loved, as Buddha loved.

Author: Richard Phillips
Quote: When you think about Dada and the great moments in Modern Art, it's always the sense of when you're not sure that art is most likely to be occurring.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: When art dresses in worn-out material it is most easily recognized as art.

Author: Karl Marx
Quote: Art is always and everywhere the secret confession, and at the same time the immortal movement of its time.

Author: R. Buckminster Fuller
Quote: Parents are usually more careful to bestow knowledge on their children rather than virtue, the art of speaking well rather than doing well; but their manners should be of the greatest concern.

Author: Henri Poincare
Quote: Mathematics is the art of giving the same name to different things.

Author: Gunter Grass
Quote: Art is accusation, expression, passion. Art is a fight to the finish between black charcoal and white paper.

Author: Jack White
Quote: It is a myth that art has to be sold. It is not like stocking a grocery store where people fill a pushcart. Art is a product that has no apparent need. The salesperson builds the need in the mind of the buyer.

Author: Novala Takemoto
Quote: There are so many awful things in this world, but I wanted readers to share with me the small, beautiful, enjoyable things. Things like cute clothes, beautiful art and pretty flowers; items that are overflowing with beauty. If you just become obsessed with your own problems, you miss these things. When you discover them, you become happy.

Author: Truman Capote
Quote: Writing stopped being fun when I discovered the difference between good writing and bad and, even more terrifying, the difference between it and true art. And after that, the whip came down.

Author: William Osler
Quote: Medicine is a science of uncertainty and an art of probability.

Author: Arnold Palmer
Quote: What other people may find in poetry or art museums, I find in the flight of a good drive.

Author: Sean Patrick Thomas
Quote: I did study the art of being a barber because I wanted to figure out what my routine would be. Do you start in the front or back? Top or bottom? Swivel the chair or walk around? What I did discover is there's no such thing as the perfect haircut!

Author: Dan Brown
Quote: Washington, D.C., has everything that Rome, Paris and London have in the way of great architecture - great power bases. Washington has obelisks and pyramids and underground tunnels and great art and a whole shadow world that we really don't see.

Author: Walter Savage Landor
Quote: Music is God's gift to man, the only art of Heaven given to earth, the only art of earth we take to Heaven.

Author: William Blake
Quote: He who would do good to another must do it in Minute Particulars: general Good is the plea of the scoundrel, hypocrite, and flatterer, for Art and Science cannot exist but in minutely organized Particulars.

Author: Sylvia Plath
Quote: Dying is an art, like everything else. I do it exceptionally well. I do it so it feels like hell. I do it so it feels real. I guess you could say I've a call.

Author: David Rakoff
Quote: A secondhand wardrobe hand clothes doesn't make one an artist. Neither do a hair-trigger temper, melancholic nature, propensity for tears, hating your parents, or HIV. I hate to say it - none of these make one an artist. They can help, but just as being gay doesn't make one witty... the only thing that makes one an artist is making art.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: It is the spectator, and not life, that art really mirrors.

Author: Salma Hayek
Quote: I have never denied my background or my culture. I have taught my child to embrace her Mexican heritage, to love my first language, Spanish, to learn about Mexican history, music, folk art, food, and even the Mexican candy I grew up with.

Author: Anais Nin
Quote: It is the function of art to renew our perception. What we are familiar with we cease to see. The writer shakes up the familiar scene, and, as if by magic, we see a new meaning in it.

Author: Julia Child
Quote: In France, cooking is a serious art form and a national sport.

Author: Arsene Wenger
Quote: I believe the target of anything in life should be to do it so well that it becomes an art.

Author: Paul Simon
Quote: I would be willing to do almost anything to make Art happy. I care about our friendship. The only thing I won't do is change the essence of my work.

Author: Craig Brown
Quote: Cleanliness is the scourge of art.

Author: Ben Jonson
Quote: They say Princes learn no art truly, but the art of horsemanship. The reason is, the brave beast is no flatterer. He will throw a prince as soon as his groom.

Author: Auguste Rodin
Quote: The artist must create a spark before he can make a fire and before art is born, the artist must be ready to be consumed by the fire of his own creation.

Author: Tom Stoppard
Quote: I was an awful critic. I operated on the assumption that there was an absolute scale of values against which art could be measured. I didn't trust my own subjective responses.

Author: Robert Musil
Quote: Layer by layer art strips life bare.

Author: John Wayne
Quote: Real art is basic emotion. If a scene is handled with simplicity - and I don't mean simple - it'll be good, and the public will know it.

Author: Diane von Furstenberg
Quote: There's design, and there's art. Good design is total harmony. There's no better designer than nature - if you look at a branch or a leaf, it's perfect. It's all function. Art is different. It's about emotion. It's about suffering and beauty - but mostly suffering!

Author: Charles Horton Cooley
Quote: An artist cannot fail; it is a success to be one.

Author: Marina Abramovic
Quote: Performance has to be mainstream art. This is what I'm fighting for.

Author: Tony Hawk
Quote: I feel like skateboarding is as much of a sport as a lifestyle, and an art form, so there's so much that that transcends in terms of music, fashion, and entertainment.

Author: Josef Albers
Quote: In visual perception a color is almost never seen as it really is - as it physically is. This fact makes color the most relative medium in art.

Author: Sonny Perdue
Quote: Our best teachers do more than impart facts and figures - they inspire and encourage students and instill a true desire to learn. That's a fine art in itself.

Author: Hans-Ulrich Obrist
Quote: Making art is not the matter of a moment, and nor is making an exhibition; curating follows art.

Author: Edgar Wright
Quote: I used to stay up all night playing 'Resident Evil 2,' and it wouldn't stop until the sun came up. Then I'd walk outside at dawn's first light, looking at the empty streets of London, and it was like life imitating art. It felt like I'd stepped into an actual zombie apocalypse.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: For art to exist, for any sort of aesthetic activity to exist, a certain physiological precondition is indispensable: intoxication.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: Admiration for a quality or an art can be so strong that it deters us from striving to possess it.

Author: Joel Osteen
Quote: Yes, the Bible should be taught in our schools because it is necessary to understand the Bible if we are to truly understand our own culture and how it came to be. The Bible has influenced every part of western culture from our art, music, and history, to our sense of fairness, charity, and business.

Author: Lord Byron
Quote: The great art of life is sensation, to feel that we exist, even in pain.

Author: Thomas Browne
Quote: All things are artificial, for nature is the art of God.

Author: Andy Warhol
Quote: We live in an age when the traditional great subjects - the human form, the landscape, even newer traditions such as abstract expressionism - are daily devalued by commercial art.

Author: Bernie Siegel
Quote: Feelings aroused by the touch of someone's hand, the sound of music, the smell of a flower, a beautiful sunset, a work of art, love, laughter, hope and faith - all work on both the unconscious and the conscious aspects of the self, and they have physiological consequences as well.

Author: William Morris
Quote: History has remembered the kings and warriors, because they destroyed; art has remembered the people, because they created.

Author: Otto von Bismarck
Quote: Politics is the art of the possible.

Author: Arsene Wenger
Quote: Football is an art, like dancing is an art - but only when it's well done does it become an art.

Author: Sutton Foster
Quote: Ballet is an incredibly difficult, beautiful art form that takes a lot of training, a lot of time, and a lot of hard work.

Author: Danny Meyer
Quote: You wouldn't have the same art on the walls at every restaurant or the same waiter uniforms. Neither should you have the same service style at every restaurant.

Author: Kenny Scharf
Quote: Part of what I do and what I want to do is I want to bring art into the everyday life. If you can take ordinary just walking in the street and you're confronted by something, that might change your day - it might inspire you.

Author: John Updike
Quote: Art is like baby shoes. When you coat them with gold, they can no longer be worn.

Author: Austin O'Malley
Quote: Reason clears and plants the wilderness of the imagination to harvest the wheat of art.

Author: Philip Johnson
Quote: Architecture is basically the design of interiors, the art of organizing interior space.

Author: Claude Monet
Quote: People discuss my art and pretend to understand as if it were necessary to understand, when it's simply necessary to love.

Author: Edgar Degas
Quote: No art is less spontaneous than mine. What I do is the result of reflection and the study of the great masters.

Author: Aldous Huxley
Quote: Perhaps it's good for one to suffer. Can an artist do anything if he's happy? Would he ever want to do anything? What is art, after all, but a protest against the horrible inclemency of life?

Author: Damien Chazelle
Quote: My motivation for being a good drummer was born out of fear, which, in a way, seems so antithetical to what art should be.

Author: Roy Lichtenstein
Quote: I think we're much smarter than we were. Everybody knows that abstract art can be art, and most people know that they may not like it, even if they understand there's another purpose to it.

Author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton
Quote: In life, as in art, the beautiful moves in curves.

Author: Camille Paglia
Quote: Does art have a future? Performance genres like opera, theater, music and dance are thriving all over the world, but the visual arts have been in slow decline for nearly 40 years. No major figure of profound influence has emerged in painting or sculpture since the waning of Pop Art and the birth of Minimalism in the early 1970s.

Author: Jeanette Winterson
Quote: Art saved me; it got me through my depression and self-loathing, back to a place of innocence.

Author: Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu
Quote: Movies become art after editing. Instead of just reproducing reality, they juxtapose images of it. That implies expression; that's art.

Author: Joshua Foer
Quote: During the Middle Ages they understood that words accompanied by imagery are much more memorable. By making the margins of a book colorful and beautiful, illuminations help make the text unforgettable. It's unfortunate that we've lost the art of illumination.

Author: Marilyn French
Quote: Nature is inside art as its content, not outside as its model.

Author: C. S. Lewis
Quote: Even in literature and art, no man who bothers about originality will ever be original: whereas if you simply try to tell the truth (without caring twopence how often it has been told before) you will, nine times out of ten, become original without ever having noticed it.

Author: Paulo Coelho
Quote: I have seen many storms in my life. Most storms have caught me by surprise, so I had to learn very quickly to look further and understand that I am not capable of controlling the weather, to exercise the art of patience and to respect the fury of nature.

Author: Will Durant
Quote: To say nothing, especially when speaking, is half the art of diplomacy.

Author: Mae West
Quote: Love isn't an emotion or an instinct - it's an art.

Author: Malcolm Muggeridge
Quote: Every happening, great and small, is a parable whereby God speaks to us, and the art of life is to get the message.

Author: Apolo Ohno
Quote: It is not up to me whether I win or lose. Ultimately, this might not be my day. And it is that philosophy towards sports, something that I really truly live by. I am emotional. I want to win. I am hungry. I am a competitor. I have that fire. But deep down, I truly enjoy the art of competing so much more than the result.

Author: John Kenneth Galbraith
Quote: Politics is the art of choosing between the disastrous and the unpalatable.

Author: Jean Cocteau
Quote: Art is a marriage of the conscious and the unconscious.

Author: Peter Hammill
Quote: Actually I think Art lies in both directions - the broad strokes, big picture but on the other hand the minute examination of the apparently mundane. Seeing the whole world in a grain of sand, that kind of thing.

Author: C. S. Lewis
Quote: Friendship is unnecessary, like philosophy, like art... It has no survival value; rather it is one of those things that give value to survival.

Author: Martin Luther King, Jr.
Quote: The art of acceptance is the art of making someone who has just done you a small favor wish that he might have done you a greater one.

Author: Albert Ellis
Quote: The art of love is largely the art of persistence.

Author: Mark Van Doren
Quote: The art of teaching is the art of assisting discovery.

Author: E. M. Forster
Quote: History develops, art stands still.

Author: Thomas Shadwell
Quote: Words may be false and full of art; Sighs are the natural language of the heart.

Author: Wynton Marsalis
Quote: Jazz music is America's past and its potential, summed up and sanctified and accessible to anybody who learns to listen to, feel, and understand it. The music can connect us to our earlier selves and to our better selves-to-come. It can remind us of where we fit on the time line of human achievement, an ultimate value of art.

Author: Frank Stella
Quote: No art is any good unless you can feel how it's put together. By and large it's the eye, the hand and if it's any good, you feel the body. Most of the best stuff seems to be a complete gesture, the totality of the artist's body; you can really lean on it.

Author: James Cash Penney
Quote: The art of effective listening is essential to clear communication, and clear communication is necessary to management success.

Author: Edgar Degas
Quote: Art is not what you see, but what you make others see.

Author: Henri Matisse
Quote: What I dream of is an art of balance, of purity and serenity devoid of troubling or depressing subject matter - a soothing, calming influence on the mind, rather like a good armchair which provides relaxation from physical fatigue.

Author: Harvey Fierstein
Quote: Art has the power to transform, to illuminate, to educate, inspire and motivate.

Author: Hippocrates
Quote: Wherever the art of medicine is loved, there is also a love of humanity.

Author: Ulysses S. Grant
Quote: The art of war is simple enough. Find out where your enemy is. Get at him as soon as you can. Strike him as hard as you can, and keep moving on.

Author: Georg Cantor
Quote: In mathematics the art of proposing a question must be held of higher value than solving it.

Author: Robert Musil
Quote: Don't you know that every perfect life would mean the end of art?

Author: John Updike
Quote: Professionalism in art has this difficulty: To be professional is to be dependable, to be dependable is to be predictable, and predictability is esthetically boring - an anti-virtue in a field where we hope to be astonished and startled and at some deep level refreshed.

Author: Max Beerbohm
Quote: When hospitality becomes an art it loses its very soul.

Author: Chinua Achebe
Quote: Art is man's constant effort to create for himself a different order of reality from that which is given to him.

Author: Helen Mirren
Quote: It'll be the Internet and piracy that will kill film. There's a philosophy that the Internet should be free, but the reality is that piracy will destroy the film industry and film as an art form because it's expensive to make a movie. Maybe you'll have funky little independent movies, and it'll go back and then start up again some other way.

Author: Robert Pinsky
Quote: I think art is not an ornament or refinement at the fringes of human intelligence, I think it's at the center. It's at the core.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: The mark of all good art is not that the thing done is done exactly or finely, for machinery may do as much, but that it is worked out with the head and the workman's heart.

Author: Andre Malraux
Quote: An art book is a museum without walls.

Author: Craig Brown
Quote: My life is a monument to procrastination, to the art of putting things off until later, or much later, or possibly never.

Author: Ai Weiwei
Quote: If my art has nothing to do with people's pain and sorrow, what is 'art' for?

Author: Josh Peck
Quote: Real artists take the misery and sadness of life and translate it into art.

Author: Groucho Marx
Quote: Well, Art is Art, isn't it? Still, on the other hand, water is water. And east is east and west is west and if you take cranberries and stew them like applesauce they taste much more like prunes than rhubarb does. Now you tell me what you know.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: When thou art above measure angry, bethink thee how momentary is man's life.

Author: Charles de Lint
Quote: The beginning of a friendship, the fact that two people out of the thousands around them can meet and connect and become friends, seems like a kind of magic to me. But maintaining a friendship requires work. I don't mean that as a bad thing. Good art requires work as well.

Author: John Lasseter
Quote: The art challenges the technology, and the technology inspires the art.

Author: Louis Nizer
Quote: A beautiful lady is an accident of nature. A beautiful old lady is a work of art.

Author: John O'Donohue
Quote: The human soul is hungry for beauty; we seek it everywhere - in landscape, music, art, clothes, furniture, gardening, companionship, love, religion, and in ourselves. No one would desire not to be beautiful. When we experience the beautiful, there is a sense of homecoming.

Author: Ovid
Quote: Art lies by its own artifice.

Author: Giuseppe Verdi
Quote: I adore art... when I am alone with my notes, my heart pounds and the tears stream from my eyes, and my emotion and my joys are too much to bear.

Author: Karen DeCrow
Quote: No matter what is happening in life or in the world - war, natural disaster, poor health, pain, the death of loved ones - if existence is filled with art, music and literature, life will be fulfilling, a joy.

Author: Daphne Guinness
Quote: There hasn't been anything real since grunge. That was the last movement led by music or an art form.

Author: Arthur Erickson
Quote: Whenever we witness art in a building, we are aware of an energy contained by it.

Author: Keith Haring
Quote: If commercialization is putting my art on a shirt so that a kid who can't afford a $30,000 painting can buy one, then I'm all for it.

Author: Darren Criss
Quote: As a composer and as a musician I'm a true believer - and this is not to be overly diplomatic - I'm a believer that there's artistry in everything from a lawn gnome to a desk chair to a symphony to an Andy Warhol painting. There's art in absolutely everything.

Author: Henry A. Kissinger
Quote: Art is man's expression of his joy in labor.

Author: Samuel Butler
Quote: The history of art is the history of revivals.

Author: J. Paul Getty
Quote: The beauty one can find in art is one of the pitifully few real and lasting products of human endeavor.

Author: Marcel Duchamp
Quote: I don't believe in art. I believe in artists.

Author: J. Paul Getty
Quote: My love of fine art increased - the more of it I saw, the more of it I wanted to see.

Author: Laurie Anderson
Quote: I've never really had a hobby, unless you count art, which the IRS once told me I had to declare as a hobby since I hadn't made money with it.

Author: Francis Ford Coppola
Quote: Art depends on luck and talent.

Author: Malcolm de Chazal
Quote: Art is nature speeded up and God slowed down.

Author: James Huneker
Quote: Great art is an instant arrested in eternity.

Author: Robert Indiana
Quote: I realize that protest paintings are not exactly in vogue, but I've done many.

Author: Peter De Vries
Quote: Murals in restaurants are on a par with the food in museums.

Author: Robert Indiana
Quote: I think of my peace paintings as one long poem, with each painting being a single stanza.

Author: David Rockefeller
Quote: The Japanese have a wonderful sense of design and a refinement in their art. They try to produce beautiful paintings with the minimum number of strokes.

Author: Octavio Paz
Quote: Art is an invention of aesthetics, which in turn is an invention of philosophers... What we call art is a game.

Author: Louis Dudek
Quote: The philistine provides the best definition of art. Anything that makes him rage is first class.

Author: Kary Mullis
Quote: Art is subject to arbitrary fashion.

Author: Jay Kay
Quote: I'm not gonna give the British Government the joy of keeping taxing me. They don't tax art. And all my cars are just a collection of art.

Author: Sol LeWitt
Quote: When artists make art, they shouldn't question whether it is permissible to do one thing or another.

Author: Novalis
Quote: The artist belongs to his work, not the work to the artist.

Author: Theodor Adorno
Quote: Art is magic delivered from the lie of being truth.

Author: Ezra Pound
Quote: All great art is born of the metropolis.

Author: Damien Hirst
Quote: In an artwork you're always looking for artistic decisions, so an ashtray is perfect. An ashtray has got life and death.

Author: Maurice Chevalier
Quote: An artist carries on throughout his life a mysterious, uninterrupted conversation with his public.

Author: Don Marquis
Quote: Procrastination is the art of keeping up with yesterday.

Author: Octavia Butler
Quote: Sometimes being a friend means mastering the art of timing. There is a time for silence. A time to let go and allow people to hurl themselves into their own destiny. And a time to prepare to pick up the pieces when it's all over.

Author: Sun Tzu
Quote: The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.

Author: Alvar Aalto
Quote: Building art is a synthesis of life in materialised form. We should try to bring in under the same hat not a splintered way of thinking, but all in harmony together.

Author: Leonardo da Vinci
Quote: The human foot is a masterpiece of engineering and a work of art.

Author: Frank Lloyd Wright
Quote: The mother art is architecture. Without an architecture of our own we have no soul of our own civilization.

Author: Hippocrates
Quote: Wherever the art of medicine is loved, there is also a love of humanity.

Author: Laurence J. Peter
Quote: Originality is the fine art of remembering what you hear but forgetting where you heard it.

Author: Kevin Brownlow
Quote: Silent pictures show us how we lived and what our attitudes were. And as an art form, they can be wonderfully entertaining and often inspirational.

Author: Hans Hofmann
Quote: Art cannot result from sophisticated, frivolous, or superficial effects.

Author: Herbert Read
Quote: The modern work of art, as I have said, is a symbol.

Author: Pierre Bonnard
Quote: Art will never be able to exist without nature.

Author: Norman McLaren
Quote: Animation is not the art of drawings that move but the art of movements that are drawn.

Author: Vince Vaughn
Quote: I enjoy going out by myself... always have, always will. I don't have security guards, and, for the most part, I enjoy meeting new people. I see myself as a regular guy who likes playing video games with his nieces and nephews and poker with his family. I don't have an art collection or take exotic vacations. I enjoy being at home.

Author: Julia Morgan
Quote: Architecture is a visual art, and the buildings speak for themselves.

Author: Balthus
Quote: I refuse to confide and don't like it when people write about art.

Author: Havelock Ellis
Quote: All the art of living lies in a fine mingling of letting go and holding on.

Author: James Cash Penney
Quote: The art of effective listening is essential to clear communication, and clear communication is necessary to management success.

Author: Tony Blair
Quote: The art of leadership is saying no, not saying yes. It is very easy to say yes.

Author: Martin Amis
Quote: Only in art will the lion lie down with the lamb, and the rose grow without thorn.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe
Quote: Were I called on to define, very briefly, the term Art, I should call it 'the reproduction of what the Senses perceive in Nature through the veil of the soul.' The mere imitation, however accurate, of what is in Nature, entitles no man to the sacred name of 'Artist.'

Author: Morihei Ueshiba
Quote: To injure an opponent is to injure yourself. To control aggression without inflicting injury is the Art of Peace.

Author: Akhenaton
Quote: Those who gave thee a body, furnished it with weakness; but He who gave thee Soul, armed thee with resolution. Employ it, and thou art wise; be wise and thou art happy.

Author: John Wooden
Quote: Be true to yourself. Make each day a masterpiece. Help others. Drink deeply from good books. Make friendship a fine art. Build a shelter against a rainy day.

Author: W. H. Auden
Quote: What the mass media offers is not popular art, but entertainment which is intended to be consumed like food, forgotten, and replaced by a new dish.

Author: Will Rogers
Quote: Diplomacy is the art of saying 'Nice doggie' until you can find a rock.

Author: George Bernard Shaw
Quote: She had lost the art of conversation but not, unfortunately, the power of speech.

Author: Yayoi Kusama
Quote: I wanted to start a revolution, using art to build the sort of society I myself envisioned.

Author: Paul Hawken
Quote: Good management is the art of making problems so interesting and their solutions so constructive that everyone wants to get to work and deal with them.

Author: Ludwig van Beethoven
Quote: Art! Who comprehends her? With whom can one consult concerning this great goddess?

Author: Paul Cezanne
Quote: With an apple I will astonish Paris.

Author: W. Somerset Maugham
Quote: Every production of an artist should be the expression of an adventure of his soul.

Author: Andy Warhol
Quote: I'm afraid that if you look at a thing long enough, it loses all of its meaning.

Author: Walt Disney
Quote: I never called my work an 'art'. It's part of show business, the business of building entertainment.

Author: Ansel Adams
Quote: You don't take a photograph, you make it.

Author: Ellen Key
Quote: The more horrifying this world becomes, the more art becomes abstract.

Author: Roy Lichtenstein
Quote: Art doesn't transform. It just plain forms.

Author: Georges Braque
Quote: Once an object has been incorporated in a picture it accepts a new destiny.

Author: Simone Weil
Quote: To want friendship is a great fault. Friendship ought to be a gratuitous joy, like the joys afforded by art or life.

Author: Albert Camus
Quote: A guilty conscience needs to confess. A work of art is a confession.

Author: Hedy Lamarr
Quote: A good painting to me has always been like a friend. It keeps me company, comforts and inspires.

Author: Gertrude Stein
Quote: A writer should write with his eyes and a painter paint with his ears.

Author: Constantin Stanislavski
Quote: Love the art in yourself and not yourself in the art.

Author: Robert Delaunay
Quote: Painting is by nature a luminous language.

Author: Andre Gide
Quote: Art is a collaboration between God and the artist, and the less the artist does the better.

Author: Salvador Dali
Quote: Painting is an infinitely minute part of my personality.

Author: Alexander Pope
Quote: So vast is art, so narrow human wit.

Author: Paul Gauguin
Quote: Art is either plagiarism or revolution.

Author: Henri Matisse
Quote: Drawing is like making an expressive gesture with the advantage of permanence.

Author: Robert Rauschenberg
Quote: You begin with the possibilities of the material.

Author: Edgar Degas
Quote: Painting is easy when you don't know how, but very difficult when you do.

Author: George Santayana
Quote: An artist is a dreamer consenting to dream of the actual world.

Author: Arne Jacobsen
Quote: If a building becomes architecture, then it is art.

Author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
Quote: Lying in bed would be an altogether perfect and supreme experience if only one had a colored pencil long enough to draw on the ceiling.

Author: Unknown
Quote: A picture is worth a thousand words.

Author: Friedrich Schiller
Quote: Art is the right hand of Nature. The latter has only given us being, the former has made us men.

Author: John Baldessari
Quote: I could never figure out why photography and art had separate histories. So I decided to explore both.

Author: Jandy Nelson
Quote: I have had this longstanding interest in going back to school to get a Ph.D. in art history. I was especially interested in exploring this idea of the ecstatic impulse in an artist.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: If a work of art is rich and vital and complete, those who have artistic instincts will see its beauty, and those to whom ethics appeal more strongly than aesthetics will see its moral lesson. It will fill the cowardly with terror, and the unclean will see in it their own shame.

Author: Jason Reitman
Quote: Creating a wonderful drama is an art form, while comedy is just entertainment.

Author: Charles de Lint
Quote: The beginning of a friendship, the fact that two people out of the thousands around them can meet and connect and become friends, seems like a kind of magic to me. But maintaining a friendship requires work. I don't mean that as a bad thing. Good art requires work as well.

Author: Mstislav Rostropovich
Quote: People are craving this great progress in electronics, going after computers, the Internet, etc. It's a giant progress technologically. But they must have a balance of soul, a balance for human beauty. That means art has an important role.

Author: Cy Twombly
Quote: I look at a lot of artists. I'm inspired by - I suppose I shouldn't say 'inspired,' but it's not really influenced. I am inspired. Art comes from art.

Author: Melanie Brown
Quote: I collect art. I just recently bought two gorgeous photographs of Marilyn Monroe by international photographer Eve Arnold and I know it sounds horrible but when she dies all her pictures are going to be worth triple. But I won't tell you how much I got them for - let's just say it was a lot.

Author: Jeffrey Deitch
Quote: I believe that an art exhibition can be engaging, fun and deeply intellectually satisfying and serious. These are not contradictory concepts in art.

Author: Luis von Ahn
Quote: Game design is a funny thing. There are people out there who are really good at it, but it's not clear that they can teach it. It's a very intuitive process. It's an art.

Author: Hugh Laurie
Quote: Music is one of the noblest callings I can think of. It's the highest of all the art forms to me. For example, if my kid said to me, 'I want to give it all up,' whatever it is that they're doing, 'and I want to take my saxophone and go out,' I would say, 'May God go with you. This is a great and noble thing that you're doing.'

Author: CeeLo Green
Quote: Women are our most miraculous muse, an enchanted intangibility that encourages all art.

Author: Mark Bradford
Quote: I look at art as a container. You can't get inside it, so you have to ask all of these questions.

Author: Danica McKellar
Quote: One of the most amazing things about mathematics is the people who do math aren't usually interested in application, because mathematics itself is truly a beautiful art form. It's structures and patterns, and that's what we love, and that's what we get off on.

Author: Christo
Quote: The work of art is a scream of freedom.

Author: Claude Bernard
Quote: Art is I; science is we.

Author: Michael Leunig
Quote: There are times when the art world seems like a religious empire. There are great cathedral galleries and pilgrimage sites where treasured art pieces are displayed like holy relics, and this can certainly be a great pleasure on a rainy Sunday afternoon.

Author: Aristotle
Quote: Rhetoric may be defined as the faculty of observing in any given case the available means of persuasion. This is not a function of any other art.

Author: Alfred North Whitehead
Quote: Art is the imposing of a pattern on experience, and our aesthetic enjoyment is recognition of the pattern.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: No better way is there to learn to love Nature than to understand Art. It dignifies every flower of the field. And, the boy who sees the thing of beauty which a bird on the wing becomes when transferred to wood or canvas will probably not throw the customary stone.

Author: Henry Ward Beecher
Quote: The art of being happy lies in the power of extracting happiness from common things.

Author: W. H. Auden
Quote: 'Healing,' Papa would tell me, 'is not a science, but the intuitive art of wooing nature.'

Author: Kristin Scott Thomas
Quote: In fact, in many ways my mother was quite hippy-dippy, serving macrobiotic food and reading 'Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance.'

Author: Paul Cezanne
Quote: The most seductive thing about art is the personality of the artist himself.

Author: Gustave Flaubert
Quote: Art requires neither complaisance nor politeness; nothing but faith, faith and freedom.

Author: Carl Honore
Quote: In our fast-forward culture, we have lost the art of eating well. Food is often little more than fuel to pour down the hatch while doing other stuff - surfing the Web, driving, walking along the street. Dining al desko is now the norm in many workplaces. All of this speed takes a toll. Obesity, eating disorders and poor nutrition are rife.

Author: Charles Rosen
Quote: A love of classical music is only partially a natural response to hearing the works performed, it also must come about by a decision to listen carefully, to pay close attention, a decision inevitably motivated by the cultural and social prestige of the art.

Author: Tom Ford
Quote: I love to design. I am a commercial fashion designer. I always design jackets with two sleeves. I don't design jackets with three sleeves, or the layers and layers come off like little dolls from Russia. Fashion for me is a creative endeavor, but it is not art for me.

Author: Sheena Iyengar
Quote: Balancing hopes, desires and an appreciating of the possibilities with a clear-eyed assessment of the limitations: that is the art of choosing.

Author: Chris Brown
Quote: Whether it be personal or musical, I just think I'm a walking art piece, just a ball of creativity.

Author: Sylvia Earle
Quote: I love my Force Fins, which are the kind of fins Special Forces use and really are adapted from the fins of fish. They're very efficient. They are so beautiful, a pair is in the Museum of Modern Art. The set I have are ruby red. I call them my ruby flippers.

Author: Jet Li
Quote: Jackie Chan is a very good comedy/martial arts star. He does one kind of martial arts that Jet Li doesn't know how to do and Jet Li does a martial art that Jackie Chan doesn't know how to do. You can both go to two Chinese restaurants, but both can have different kinds of food.

Author: Thom Mayne
Quote: The huge problem in our society is the enormous ignorance of the ideas that underlie modern art.

Author: Stefan Zweig
Quote: Never can the innate power of a work be hidden or locked away. A work of art can be forgotten by time; it can be forbidden and rejected but the elemental will always prevail over the ephemeral.

Author: Patrick Stump
Quote: When you're a little kid, you just like music that makes you happy and is fun. As you get older, you reach college or your 20s and you decide that music should be challenging and all art should be smart. So you start to think it makes you like high art more to put down things you consider low art. I don't even think things are low art.

Author: Jeffrey Brown
Quote: I was always most interested in drawing - most of my childhood drawings are black-and-white line work. And when I kind of abandoned comics, through college and art school, I was doing a lot of painting. But once I started doing comics again, everything else just fell by the wayside.

Author: Judy Chicago
Quote: I am trying to make art that relates to the deepest and most mythic concerns of human kind and I believe that, at this moment of history, feminism is humanism.

Author: Pablo Picasso
Quote: The purpose of art is washing the dust of daily life off our souls.

Author: Austin Nichols
Quote: I believe in the healing power of the arts, and whenever anyone can bring art into anyone's life, it's a special thing.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: A critic should be taught to criticise a work of art without making any reference to the personality of the author.

Author: George Bernard Shaw
Quote: A fool's brain digests philosophy into folly, science into superstition, and art into pedantry. Hence University education.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: Philosophically considered, the universe is composed of Nature and the Soul. Strictly speaking, therefore, all that is separate from us, all which Philosophy distinguishes as the 'Not Me,' that is, both nature and art, all other men and my own body, must be ranked under this name, 'Nature.'

Author: Charles Bukowski
Quote: To do a dull thing with style-now that's what I call art.

Author: Andre Maurois
Quote: Memory is a great artist. For every man and for every woman it makes the recollection of his or her life a work of art and an unfaithful record.

Author: Eddie Vedder
Quote: It's an art to live with pain... mix the light into gray.

Author: Madonna Ciccone
Quote: I like to change. A new lamp, a piece of art, can transform a room.

Author: CeeLo Green
Quote: Balance is key. Balance is a virtue. Balance is next to godliness, maybe. We should all aspire to better balance. Too much of what is said in this world is one-sided, and we need more balance - in our speech, in our music, in our art, in everything.

Author: Andy Warhol
Quote: Land really is the best art.

Author: Milan Kundera
Quote: You can understand nothing about art, particularly modern art, if you do not understand that imagination is a value in itself.

Author: Jerry Saltz
Quote: Works of art often last forever, or nearly so. But exhibitions themselves, especially gallery exhibitions, are like flowers; they bloom and then they die, then exist only as memories, or pressed in magazines and books.

Author: Nick Cannon
Quote: One thing about being a stand-up is it's a one-man show. You gotta do everything. You're the producer, writer, director, and the actor. You just gotta be out there and perform and give your all. It's such an honest form of art that it just taught me so much, and it kind of prepared me for manhood at an early age.

Author: Jeff Koons
Quote: I believe that my art gets across the point that I'm in this morality theater trying to help the underdog, and I'm speaking socially here, showing concern and making psychological and philosophical statements for the underdog.

Author: James Franco
Quote: The first piece of art that I ever bought-when I could afford it-was a Warhol sketch from the period when he was just getting out of doing commercial work and more into art. It's a sketch of a young guy's face. I guess the gallery that I bought it from thought I would like it because the young guy kind of looked like James Dean.

Author: Epicurus
Quote: The art of living well and the art of dying well are one.

Author: William Hazlitt
Quote: Life is the art of being well deceived; and in order that the deception may succeed it must be habitual and uninterrupted.

Author: Hans Hofmann
Quote: A work of art is a world in itself reflecting senses and emotions of the artist's world.

Author: Aristotle
Quote: Those who educate children well are more to be honored than they who produce them; for these only gave them life, those the art of living well.

Author: Rebecca West
Quote: Any authentic work of art must start an argument between the artist and his audience.

Author: Frank Wedekind
Quote: Any fool can have bad luck; the art consists in knowing how to exploit it.

Author: Freddie Mercury
Quote: I got my diploma from Ealing College of Art, in graphics and illustration.

Author: Beyonce Knowles
