Quote: Whenever I think about movies, I always look at that art process as having the best of a lot of worlds. Because if you watch a great film, you have a musical element to it, not just on the scoring, but in the way that the shots are edited - that has music and rhythm and time.

Author: Andre Gide
Quote: There is no prejudice that the work of art does not finally overcome.

Author: Robert M. Pirsig
Quote: The study of the art of motorcycle maintenance is really a miniature study of the art of rationality itself. Working on a motorcycle, working well, caring, is to become part of a process, to achieve an inner peace of mind. The motorcycle is primarily a mental phenomenon.

Author: Jada Pinkett Smith
Quote: Art should never be limited - the beauty of art is that it gives us the freedom to go places where we wouldn't go to in our normal lives. Inside, I'm just so many different people. I go from the pretty girl on the red carpet to the singer at Ozzfest, spitting in the crowd. That's Jada.

Author: Maya Angelou
Quote: Find a beautiful piece of art. If you fall in love with Van Gogh or Matisse or John Oliver Killens, or if you fall love with the music of Coltrane, the music of Aretha Franklin, or the music of Chopin - find some beautiful art and admire it, and realize that that was created by human beings just like you, no more human, no less.

Author: James Frey
Quote: When I go to an art gallery and stand in front of a painting, I don't want someone telling me what I should be seeing or thinking; I want to feel whatever I feel, see whatever I see, and figure out what I figure out.

Author: Luc de Clapiers
Quote: Patience is the art of hoping.

Author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
Quote: Motivation is the art of getting people to do what you want them to do because they want to do it.

Author: Leon Trotsky
Quote: Insurrection is an art, and like all arts has its own laws.

Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
Quote: Let's say intelligence is your ability to compose poetry, symphonies, do art, math and science. Chimps can't do any of that, yet we share 99 percent DNA. Everything that we are, that distinguishes us from chimps, emerges from that one-percent difference.

Author: Kanye West
Quote: Creative output, you know, is just pain. I'm going to be cliche for a minute and say that great art comes from pain.

Author: Charles Baudelaire
Quote: To say the word Romanticism is to say modern art - that is, intimacy, spirituality, color, aspiration towards the infinite, expressed by every means available to the arts.

Author: Damien Hirst
Quote: It's amazing what you can do with an E in A-Level art, a twisted imagination and a chainsaw.

Author: John Keats
Quote: The excellency of every art is its intensity, capable of making all disagreeable evaporate.

Author: Louis C. K.
Quote: To me, art supplies are always okay to buy.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: Life imitates art far more than art imitates Life.

Author: James Montgomery
Quote: Blue thou art, intensely blue; Flower, whence came thy dazzling hue?

Author: Mao Zedong
Quote: There is in fact no such thing as art for art's sake, art that stands above classes, art that is detached from or independent of politics. Proletarian literature and art are part of the whole proletarian revolutionary cause.

Author: Andre Benjamin
Quote: Hip-hop don't have no fresh energy, none at all. It's money driven, everybody tryin' to make that cheque, nobody putting art in their albums any more.

Author: Bernie Siegel
Quote: Feelings aroused by the touch of someone's hand, the sound of music, the smell of a flower, a beautiful sunset, a work of art, love, laughter, hope and faith - all work on both the unconscious and the conscious aspects of the self, and they have physiological consequences as well.

Author: Sharon Creech
Quote: I especially love all the instruments of art: inks, pens, paintbrushes, watercolors and oils, fine papers and canvases, and although I love to mess around with these tools and objects, I have minimal artistic skills.

Author: William Blake
Quote: Art is the tree of life. Science is the tree of death.

Author: David Frost
Quote: Diplomacy, n. is the art of letting somebody else have your way.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: The art of living is more like wrestling than dancing.

Author: Patti Smith
Quote: In art and dream may you proceed with abandon. In life may you proceed with balance and stealth.

Author: Thornton Wilder
Quote: I regard the theatre as the greatest of all art forms, the most immediate way in which a human being can share with another the sense of what it is to be a human being.

Author: William Morris
Quote: So long as the system of competition in the production and exchange of the means of life goes on, the degradation of the arts will go on; and if that system is to last for ever, then art is doomed, and will surely die; that is to say, civilization will die.

Author: Nelson Mandela
Quote: I started to make a study of the art of war and revolution and, whilst abroad, underwent a course in military training. If there was to be guerrilla warfare, I wanted to be able to stand and fight with my people and to share the hazards of war with them.

Author: Samuel Johnson
Quote: There is nothing, Sir, too little for so little a creature as man. It is by studying little things that we attain the great art of having as little misery and as much happiness as possible.
